item_name: SamJoy Pro Hot Air Brush Dual Ionic Styler Styling Dryer Combo and Ceramic Flat Iron Purple
rating:
It arrived promptly, and I was so excited to give it a try....then, the fun was over. I am so disappointed in the design and performance of this hot brush - oh, there is no air, so not sure why the title says "Hot Air Brush" - that's a misnomer.

First disappointment - the plug. It comes with an international plug, which would be good for using it overseas, but I'm in the USA....it does come with an adapter, so points for that - HOWEVER, it does not 'grip' the outlet enough to stay plugged in during use. Any amount of movement of the cord will cause it to just drop out of the outlet - go ahead, try to use this without moving the cord (I couldn't). Next, both prongs are the very same size (not the US standard), so you have no idea which way to plug it into the outlet to get proper polarity - unless, of course, you know how to interpret the "L" and "N" label on the back of the adapter.

Next disappointment - the slider with the "LOCK and UNLOCK" symbols. I'm guessing it's supposed to lock the brush closed so you can use it mainly as a hot brush, and so it won't open to become a flat iron while you are using it as a hot brush (Why am I only guessing? Because I can't read the enclosed instructions). Anyway, you slide it closed, and all seems well - then, lift it up to your hair to roll your hair around the hot brush...but, wait - the slider has now slid back down on it's own to let the brush open, and you now have a flat iron ready to go. But, wait, I want to use it as a hot brush....slide it over to LOCK again, lift it to my hair, and there it goes again opening on it's own. Seriously??? The slider is so loose that it will move to UNLOCK on it's own with just angling the brush upwards toward your hair - or with even the slightest touch from your hand. This can actually be dangerous, as you could unwittingly put your finger inside the open flat iron that your aren't expecting to be there. So, someone please tell me how I'm supposed to use this without angling it up, or touching the handle with my hand?

Next - and last disappointment (because I'm definitely returning it at this point) is the OFF / L / H slider button. First, there is no indication what temperature L and H are, so it's a guessing game (hopefully L isn't too low to get the job done and H doesn't fry my hair). I go to the instructions - which are completely in Japanese (?), I think, and it tells me that L is 160C and H is 200C. OK, stop / Google / remember 160C = 320F, and 200C = 392F. No other temperature options to choose from. Then, the fun part - if you manage to keep the brush closed so you can hot curl your hair (refer to paragraph above), or maybe you just want to use the flat iron - start by setting the temperature you want to L or H, then begin to apply, BUT WAIT - the temperature slider switch just moved....what?!? Are you kidding me? This slider is also very loose, and placed right where your hand placement is, and any slight pressure can cause it to slide, either to another temperature setting, or off altogether. Multiple attempts to avoid this by holding the handle a different way were NOT successful.

Maybe I'm being too detail oriented - but I don't see anywhere on the hot brush where it says SamJoy....also, nowhere in the literature that I can read - but, then again, as stated - it is NOT written in English.

Does it have an Auto-Off feature? I have no idea....because I can't read the instructions! How can I find out? I guess I could duct tape the plug so it wouldn't fall out of the outlet, set the temp to L or H, then lay it down carefully so movement doesn't turn it off, set up a timer, then watch to see what happens.... but, I've already spent 45 minutes trying to use it while constantly having to plug it back in / moving the slider back to LOCK so I can use it as a hot brush / giving up and deciding to flat iron my hair / wondering why it wasn't hot enough - because the temperature slider turned it off while I was using it! Argh! Also, there's the 15 minutes collectively to unpack it, now repackaging it so I can send it back. That's a whole hour of my life I can't get back. I'm done.n't hot enough - because the temperature slider turned it off while I was using it! Argh! Also, there's the 15 minutes collectively to unpack it, now repackaging it so I can send it back. That's a whole hour of my life I can't get back. I'm done.

rating: This item is a bit bulky, but very functional. This bench straddles over the tub so a person can sit on the edge, slide back, and lift their legs into the tub. Then they are able to sit to take their shower. It was a life-saver for my Mom after breaking her left femur. She thought she would not be able to take a shower again, because she's always had some difficult lifting her legs to get into the tub/shower. But a friend told me about this device, and it has been a huge help. You will need to have a shower head that can be lifted from the holster and used as a hand-held model so that you can stay seated during the shower. item_name: ProDENT DIGITAL INTRAORAL USB DENTAL CAMERA IMAGING LAB EQUIPMENT
rating: I'm using this camera as a mechanic's tool rather than as a dental tool.  It provides a much better picture than an electronic borescope that I paid a lot more for.  It won't reach some tight spaces that the borescope will, but it can be used to inspect a lot of hard-to-reach locations.  The built-in lights are very bright so it's good for viewing dark areas.  The software that came with it works, but I have been using the webcam software that came with my laptop computer because it's easier to capture still shots with it...all you have to do is set the camera type to "USB".  My Windows 8.1 laptop recognized this device within a few seconds after I plugged it in.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the documentation is bad.  I'm still trying to figure out what the 2nd switch is for.  It's labeled as "picks up the key" in the user manual...what the heck does that mean?  Nothing seems to happen when I press it with the included software or the webcam application, but luckily I'm able to do everything I need with just the power switch.  I'm guessing it might have some function with some of the dedicated dental software packages.  It's no big deal, because this is a very useful camera with just the power switch.

item_name: GMS Med-e-lert 28 Day Automatic Pill Dispenser 6 Alarms with 6 Dosage Rings and 1 Metal Key (Clear and Solid Lids Included)
rating:
We‚Äôve had the Med-e-lert for about 4 weeks now and it has worked better than expected. We purchased this for my mother in-law who has dementia. She has been able to adapt to tilting the Med-e-lert to get her pills. For all I know, she does this many times a day but the pills are only available at the prescribed times that I set up.

The reason for 4 stars rather than 5 is that the instructions for setup are a little less clear than they could have been. I was able to setup exactly what I wanted (2 times a day, no audio alert), but it took a couple times reviewing the instructions. I don‚Äôt believe most 80+ year olds would be able to follow the instructions, so be prepared to set up the Med-e-lert for the patient. The other item I wish the Med-e-lert contained is a ‚Äúloading shield‚Äù that would help ensure that when loading the pills into the individual compartments the pill don‚Äôt accidentally fall into an adjacent compartment.

Overall, I would recommend Med-e-lert. Considering the assisted living facility wants $26 a day to ‚Äúmanage‚Äù medication, this device paid for itself in less than a week.

item_name: Straight Razor
rating:
Been using this professionally at work (Barbershop).

Initial Impressions: Razor itself has a fairly good heft behind it. It feels solid and quality. Really good quality metal as well. I like that the shaft of the razor is molded and not cut from metal. My razor if in disinfectant all day and this means it won't rust. Important for something that is made to be I and around water. The bevel on the business end is well honed and gives a clear view of the blade while working. The only thing in not absolutely fond of is the plastic piece at the end of the guard. On mine it is rough and discolored but doesn't affect the function at all. I just prefer my tools to be well maintained and this looks a bit banged up so I worry about in furture having to replace the razor.

Loading the blades: Blades are plentiful and sharp and fairly easy to load. Removing them when wet can be tricky but is pretty easy when you get the hang of it. 100 blades is a nicesize and will last me just over a month but the again I use this at work so most men thiswill last almost three months.

The Shave: The razor feels solid and quality. In terms of heft, its the closest I've come in feel to a regular stropped blade.The wieght of the razor and the sharpness of the blades combine for a pretty effortless shave, no need to press, even when shaving coarse beards or scalps. I find the razor gives the best shaves when the hair is a bit longer than everyday stubble. The blade seems to grab the extra length and give a smoother shave.

Overall I am very happy. Without that plastic piece I would say perfect. I'm not docking a star for that because it doesn't affect the function and may be just my razor

item_name: Kanger Subox Mini Starter Kit - Black Edition
rating:
Every review I read about this kit said it was great and it is nothing less. I'm not much of a cloud chaser but it's nice to have the option to fool around with. Every hit is that of perfection. I can set this thing down into the 2 volt range and still take a better hit than any ego pen I've ever used, thus conserving battery,coil,and juice life or pick up the power into the 40+ watt range in the 4+- volt area and blow a cloud big enuff to irrigate the house. Either way every hit is so much more favorable and warmer than the ego pens. Then to top off the fine tuning you can go with temptress control nickel coils if you want. You also save money by using 18650 batteries and the ability to make your own coils; which is easier than you think and yet another customizable option. There is absolutely no reason not to have this setup, the value is insanely great. $70, $15 for 2 efest batteries, and $15 for a nite core charger option if you want but don't need because this mod has a USB charging port. $100 and you got a setup you'll be in love with, and so happy you bought.
I've found a new world of flavor and satisfaction with this mod.

item_name: Pulse Oximeter, Blood Oxygen Monitor
rating: Price on this was one third of what my neighbor paid at a local drug store!  I use this several times a day when it is hot and humid to check my blood oxygen level since I have asthma.  It is sooo very helpful - I know right where I am and thus what meds to take.  I am not a medical person, but when my husband was having unusual chest pain about eleven pm one night, after checking for pain in arms, clamminess, weakness, disorientation and breathing difficulty I used this to check his pulse, heartbeat and blood oxygen.  Those all looked reasonably normal to me, although blood oxygen was low.  I gave him over-the-counter meds for gas.  A half hour and two big burps later, he felt fine and went to sleep.  The next day we went to his Dr.  Results:  No unnecessary trip to emergency room, and a scheduled sleep apnea study.

item_name: Body Back Company‚Äôs Body Back Buddy Trigger Point Therapy Self Massage Tool - PARENT
rating:
Works for me. I bought this hook, the Trigger Points fold out chart, and "The Trigger Point Therapy Workbook".

I had a frozen shoulder (left) a few years ago, went to a Chiropractor, had laser light therapy many times, and after about 18 months, it finally was close to normal.

August of 2014 I realized my right shoulder was locking up. My nephew, a new Chiropractor, suggested a medical massage therapist who understands trigger therapy. I went once. The therapist was great, but not available to me regularly due to schedule conflicts. She used clear silicone suction cups as well as essential oils and coconut oil, and massage to increase lymph flow and circulation into the corresponding trigger areas. I have not been the same since. There has been an increased speed of healing to my shoulder. plus, using all these modalities, I have treated other pain as well.

I am very pleased with the helpfulness of the Back Buddy Self-Massage Tool to reach impossible areas when self-massaging.

Do not over work the trigger points, as others have said. That will only make you too sore to continue the next day, escalating the problems.

rating:
For chocolate milk- Nestles cocoa powder works best for me; the Cacao powder just wont mix in and stays clumpy.
So far, for brownies and pudding- Cacao powder is better. Its not as strong as regular cocoa powder and therefore does not irritate any indigestion or heartburn issue I may have. At least so far. And I think it actually may taste a little better in these two desserts. Kind of a silky taste vs the stronger "harsh/acidic" taste of cocoa (which is not meant to be taken negatively of cocoa).
I can't say as the Cacao is any better than the regular cocoa powder. It depends on taste and if you want a stronger chocolate or a more "silky" one. Hey, chocolate is still chocolate in the end, as long as its good quality chocolate.

item_name: Blood Typing Test Kit Eldoncard
rating:
This is a one time use item. With that said, I screwed up on my first one. I believed I got A+ but the problem was I had too little blood on it. The reason why is that I wasn't using it on a hard surface and it rolled around. So I decided to get the 5 pack. I figure I could fail once, but not twice. And that worked for me. On my first go with this five pack I got it right. Had enough blood on the card, and it came out A+ like I originally thought. I might try another one just to be 100% sure or hand out these cards to others who might want to try.

Overall I am very pleased with these cards. I managed to get the test right after my second try. If this is your first time every doing this and you don't have anyone else you know who tried it before, I would recommend picking up more than one. That way if you mess up, or think you messed up, you at least have some back up.

item_name: Viva Naturals #1 Best Selling Certified Organic Cacao Powder from Superior Criollo Beans, 1 LB Bag
rating:
This is my first time trying Cacao powder and oh my gosh have I been missing out. If you have never tried this in your coffee you don't know what you're missing. I love that I can get some nice chocolate flavor in my coffee without all those other ingredients that come with chocolate syrups, powders and the like. With this I can get my chocolate flavor and use whichever sweetener I desire and not have to worry that they have added artificial sweeteners of any kind to it. I absolutely love it. I also love that it is organic and GMO free. It is also gluten free, and free of artificial ingredients, flavors and colors. It is soy, egg and dairy free making it vegan as well. I have only tried this in my coffee so far, but I'm definitely going to try the vegan pudding recipe that is in the description, and also a chocolate cake. This stuff is delicious and a healthy choice.

item_name: Baetea Weight Loss Tea: Detox, Body Cleanse, Reduce Bloating, & Appetite Suppressant, 14 Day Teatox, with Potent Traditional Organic Herbs, Ultimate Way to Calm and Cleanse Your Body
rating:
I just completed my 14 day TeaTox, and I'm sad it's over. I did not loose any weight from using this supplement. However, the 'detox' and refreshing ritual that started my morning was amazing. The tea was flavorful, but not strong and overwhelming, like some teas I have tried for the same effect. The ingredients are simple and are good stuff. I had no ill effects from drinking this tea on an empty stomach first thing in the morning. The package actually did last me the entire 14 days, which surprised me- I thought some morning I may have over estimated the 'dose'.

The benefits I noticed from my TeaTox were: reduced bloating, and a refreshing and revitalizing start to my day. I am already pretty 'in shape', and only have the last couple stubborn pounds to lose for my goal. So while this tea didn't make me lose pounds quickly, I really did enjoy the ritual, the flavor, and the detox benefits of the quality ingredients.

item_name: OPTP PRO-ROLLER Soft Density Foam Roller - Durable Roller for Massage, Stretching, Fitness, Yoga and Pilates
rating: This roller has the perfect density for myofascia release.  The foam gives enough under pressure to mold the the body, and exerting even pressure to the body part.  It does not exert isolated force onto a small surface area, rather it distributes the force over a wider surface area.  Hence the muscle and the connective tissues both benefits from increased blood flow and tension release.  Unlike the highly dense roller, that is popular, there is no pain involved.  Even if the roller passes over an body area, such as the lumbar region, which it should not, it is less likely to inflict pain and damage.  It is a great roller for anyone who is looking to use a roller on a regular basis either for muscle soreness and releasing tension.

rating:
It is exactly what it says it is. For a novelty item, it is great. Unique and fun, sure to generate some fun comments. The comb, however, isn't good for much other than totally mangling your hair. It's mostly for show.

From a flipping standpoint, the handles are too thin for my taste. Other than that, it seems to flip well, and took a month or so to loosen up to the point where I needed to apply locktite to the screws. Also, there is an obvious different in feel between the bite and safe sides of the blade, which is nice.

Finally, do NOT believe the Benchmade logo on the "knife's" blade. It is a forgery, and a somewhat poor one.

rating:
This stuff is amazing! I wish I had taken before and after pictures to show the difference it made. I had begun developing ezcema on the inside of my arms in the last few months. My arms itched like crazy and often were swollen with huge welts. If the pollen count was high or I was exposed to mold, they turned red and itched so bad some nights I slept with ice packs. I tried steriod creams and multiple OTC products. I was taking Benedryl every four hours. I hadn't been as so miserable from itching since I developed PUPPP during pregnancy and had hives all over (I wish I had discovered Era Cream back then!). My arms are now itch and welt free. Yesterday, I was exposed to high mold and pollen counts while deep cleaning things outside and immediately began to break out in hives. After I finished and took and shower, I put Era Cream on and my skin was back to normal within a few hours. This stuff rocks!

Sure, $25 is a little pricey for a jar of cream, but is less than many of the ointments---ones that never seem to really work-- prescribed by my doctor.

item_name: Deodorant & Travel Deodorant‚ÄìCrystal Deodorant Pack‚ÄìBest All Natural Deodorant for Men and Women‚ÄìFeel Fresh and Confident up to 48 Hours‚ÄìIncludes a Toe Applicator to Fights Stinky Feet‚ÄìExperience Real Freshness with a Natural Deodorant Crystal Now!
rating:
Crystal deodorant conjures visions of hippies with long hair, nothing shaved, and lots of freedom. That's why I've avoided crystal deodorant for so long. Silly me - it really works, and you don't have to be a hippy, have long hair - but you can shave or not, no matter.

So here's the other problem with crystal deodorant that this product totally solves - that big honking piece of deodorant. There was never anything to grab on to, except the crystal. And well, you know, you rubbed that under your arms and that was stinky, and no I have that on my hands, yuck. Crystal Zen did this super cool thing and put the crystal on a plastic base with a screw cap cover. Wow, it looks like regular old deodorant now.

No more smelly crazy hairy hippies and no more icky touching your armpit on the crystal. This stuff is heaven. Yeah, it really works. It is odorless. It prevents perspiration. And it is super easy to use. What's not to love about this?

The box is super pretty. Actually it is almost too pretty - you want to lay the crystal containers back down in their pretty satin home.

The box has three things - a big stick for home, a travel stick for um, vacation, and a skinny stick for razor burn or toes (but probably not both - you know ick).

This stuff lasts forever. The only odd thing, the crystal has to be damp. To solve that, put on your deodorant just after you shower, or dribble a little water on the crystal just before you use it. Pretty darn simple.

A fee sample was provided for review.

rating:

Update:
No complaints with the battery itself. But the device broke. There is a little metal piece in the middle that conducts the electricity. I was removing top half and it came out. It looks like the solder connection broke.

I think this may be a result of not cleaning the device properly. The top part can get sticky and it touches this conductor part. Mine was cold when I tried to remove the top part so maybe it was stuck pretty tight and I just pulled it off.

I ordered another one. In the future I will clean it better. I reduced the stars from 4 to 3. I don't think things like this should happen.
